conclusion: Identify the forces that the horizontal wire exerts on the two spring scales
Magnetic force when a current I flows: F = I L B
Direction found with the right-hand rule
For a → b (current to the right) and B into the page, the magnetic force is downward; if the current is reversed it is upward
In all situations the rod is symmetrical, so each scale carries one-half of the total vertical load
Express the readings of one scale for the two current settings

premise: Total downward load = W + I L B
conclusion: Reading of one scale: F₁ = (W + I L B)/2
Magnetic force now upward, magnitude 2I L B

premise: Total downward load = W – 2I L B
conclusion: Reading of one scale: F₂ = (W – 2I L B)/2

premise: Subtract the two expressions: F₁ – F₂ = [W + I L B – (W – 2I L B)] / 2

conclusion: Solve for the magnetic-induction intensity B
